qas.question: Where did the mountains undergo serve erosion?
What was the cause of the severe erosion?
Who noted the severe erosion of the mountains?
What was Louis Agassiz also known as?

context: In the <a0_0>Miocene Epoch<a0_0/> the mountains underwent severe erosion because of <a1_0>glaciation<a1_0/>, which was noted in the mid-19th century by naturalist <a2_0>Louis Agassiz<a2_0/> who presented a paper proclaiming the Alps were covered in ice at various intervals—a theory he formed when studying rocks near his Neuchâtel home which he believed originated to the west in the Bernese Oberland. Because of his work he came to be known as <a3_0>the "father of the ice-age concept"<a3_0/> although other naturalists before him put forth similar ideas.
